i have been involved in CIVIL MAINTAINANCE GROUP of TATA STEEL LTD. With special emphasis in water seepage, special repairing job, strengthening of various type machines, structure foundation. 
 
• Civil structure restoration / strengthening by using fiber morter, micro concrete, shortcreting. 
• Roof seepage, cable tunnel seepage, Building basement seepage, Expansion joint. 
• Core cutting, chemical bolt fixing, mechanical bolt fixing. 
• Paver block fixing, tile fixing, false ceiling, Alu. Partition, Plastering, Brick Work & concreting. 
• Knowledge on TATA STEEL IBM LOTUS APPLICATION. 
• Making Foundations for Pumps, Pipe Structures etc. 
• RCC Boundary wall and Retaining wall for material stock. 
• Conducting tool box and safety mass meeting for contractor employee. 
• Ensuring Quality & safety for all jobs running by vendor. 
• New site visit with client and making plan for job execution. 
• Planning for Major Shutdowns. 
• Taking measurement and billing after completing job by Vendor. 
• Arrangement for Manpower and Material for site execution. 
 
• STRENGTH 
 
❖ Practically optimistic & Positive attitude. 
❖ To take challenges with full responsibility. 
❖ Capability to manage change. 
❖ Hard work.

civil site engineer

-
Gujarat

October 2012 to July 2016

2) Safety of job procedure. 
3) Labour management, billing of work, Measurements of work. 
4) Foundation layout and execution for Pipe Structure and Vessel Foundation. 
 
❖ TATA STEEL LTD (Jamshedpur)

Jharkhand as Junior Engineer Civil - Freeman realty Developers LLP a JV of Deep Industries Ltd

Ranchi, Jharkhand

-

Technical competent Civil engineer having total Exp- 2 Yrs around 1+ Experience in oil & gas Industry and experience in preparation of DPR of PMGSY Road Project of Jharkhand Rural road which Involves estimation & Costing the Total Cost of Project.

Work Experience

Engineer Civil

Freeman realty Developers LLP a JV of Deep Industries Ltd
-
Ramgarh, Jharkhand
-

April 2017 to Present

Ramgarh), Jharkhand as Junior Engineer Civil. 
 
Job Profile: 
• Site co-ordination and liaison with Client, RO and Sub Contractors. 
• Site Execution, Construction supervision. 
• Monitoring & inspection of execution as per drawing and specification. 
• Project Planning, Ensuring & Safety Monitoring. 
• Man power and Materials planning, 
• Monitoring and inspection of well sites which includes Hardening of Drill Pad, Security cabin, Toilet Blocks, Fencing. 
• Management information report and daily progress report monitoring. 
• Preparation of BBS for RCC structure. 
• Sub Contractor Billing Measurement etc. 
• Proficient in Auto CAD drawing and MS Office quite knowledge. 
• Preparation of daily progress report and directly reporting to project manager for day to day activity. 
• Checking of monthly RA Bills of contractor

Assistant Engineer

Mars Planning & Engineering Services Pvt. Ltd
-
Ranchi, Jharkhand
-

July 2016 to April 2017

Job Profile: 
• Preparing BOQ, DPR, for the PMGSY Road and estimation & Costing of the Total Project Cost of the Road. 
• Given the full technical support to site staff for the smoothing execution of work. 
• Site co-ordination and liaison with Client, RO and Sub Contractors. 
• Site Execution, Construction supervision. 
• Monitoring & inspection of execution as per drawing and specification. 
• Site Execution, Construction supervision. 
• Monitoring & inspection of execution as per drawing and specification. 
• Man power and Materials planning, 
• Various types of works, Cement Concrete Road, WBM Road, Bituminous Road, Slab Culvert, Hume Pipe Culvert etc. 
• Consultant of the project Jharkhand State Rural Road Development Authority.

column3:
Hitesh Ladva

CIVIL ENGINEER

Mumbai, Maharashtra

-

Work Experience

Civil Engineer

JSV INFRASTRUCTURE PVT LTD
-
Mumbai, Maharashtra
-

February 2017 to Present

Projects Undertaken  
 Devi Smruti Society (SRA Project)- (G+20) ( JSV infrastructure)  
Activity:  
1. Checking formwork, reinforcements & all embedded items.  
2. Checking of brick work according to exact size and measurement given in the plan.  
3. Conduct daily surveillance and civil work inspection in accordance to approved plan.  
4. Handling day to day problem at site.  
5. Making daily report and reporting it to builder.  
6. Preparing working schedule with bar chart.  
7. Estimating the quantity of construction material required construction site.  
8. Coordinating with different vendor for interior work and other construction work.  
9. Coordinate with architect and RCC consultant for Timely checking and Completion of work as per Specification and schedule.  
 
 Victory Heights – G+12 Residential Apartment  
Activity:  
1. Making the safety arrangement for tenements as well as worker.  
2. Checking formwork, reinforcements & all embedded items.  
3. Checking of brick work according to exact size and measurement given in the plan.  
4. Conduct daily surveillance and civil work inspection in accordance to approved plan.  
5. Handling day to day problem at site.  
6. Making daily report and reporting it to builder.  
7. Preparing working schedule with bar chart.  
8. Estimating the quantity of construction material required construction site.  
9. Coordinating with different vendor for interior work and other construction work.  
10. Coordinate with architect and RCC consultant for Timely checking and Completion of work as per Specification and schedule. 
 
3. Madonna colony - G+9 residential project 
1. Coordinating with licensing architect and consulting architect to view and finalise the drawings and finalising rcc drawing with rcc consultant. 
2. Planning the work schedule.  
3. Preparing bar chart .

Service Engineer Trainee

Aaryan Structcon Pvt Ltd
-
Mumbai, Maharashtra
-

July 2016 to December 2016

Projects Undertaken-  
 Partial Building Demolition – In this Project our team at Aaryan Structcon Pvt Ltd has given complete estimate of Demolition of building partially. Also, we have given stability check after Demolition.  
 
 Repair Estimate –In this Project Our team has given repair estimate for 40 Buildings at MES (Military engineering service) at Colaba.  
• Activity-  
1. Visiting sites and Making Preliminary Survey report of site condition.  
2. Making Schedule for Required for multiple site work.  
3. Handling day to day problem at site.  
4. Preparing working schedule with bar chart.  
5. Estimating the quantity of construction material required construction site.  
6. Coordinating with different vendor for interior work and other repair work.  
7. Estimating Quantity of steel from BBS 
 
3. feasibility of extension- 
In this Project we need to give Report if present structure is Feasible for further extension by analyzing Structural design and Present Condition.

Education

BE(Civil Engineering ) in CIVIL ENGINEERING

MUMBAI UNIVERSITY
-
Mumbai, Maharashtra

July 2012 to July 2016

Skills

Site Execution, Project Management, Site Engineer, Autocad, Civil Engineering, bridge engineering

-

Seeking for a challenging position as a civil engineer, where I can use my planning, designing and overseeing skills in construction, design and help company to achieve its goal.

Work Experience

Civil Engineer

• Oversee construction and maintenance of facilities. 
• Handling reports and maps, Engineering, blueprints and photography. 
• Calculating requirements to plan and design the specification of the civil work required. 
• Ensure safety by monitoring the site. 
• Assisting senior in forecasting the cost quantity and budget of equipment manpower and labour. 
 
OTHER PROJECTS 
• 3 weeks project to study microbiological treatment of drinking and sewage water. 
• Two weeks case study of Noida Agra express way. 
• Two case weeks case study of Nepal earthquake. 
ACHEVMENTS 
 
• Successfully organized technical fest (as civil department head and overall head the technical fest) 
• Last semester percentage 77. 
• Among top 50 in group discussion at MRIU. 
• National level athlete (Table Tennis) 
• CBSE cluster Gold Medalist in Taekwondo.

Education

Bachelor in civil engineering

MD University

CBSE

Pragati International School
-
Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh

Additional Information

KEY SKILLS 
• High level of professionalism. 
• Excellent mathematical skills. 
• Active listener. 
• Good communication skills. 
• Team player. 
• Confident. 
• Eye for detail. 
• Quick leaner. 
 
TECHNICAL SKILLS 
• Basic knowledge of Computer with MS-Office. 
• Auto CAD-3D.

-

To pursue a challenging and dynamic career in a well established organization by imparting excellent skills to enhance the growth of the reputed organization with continuous learning in a challenging environment.

Work Experience

civil consultant

Hindustan oil Exploration Company LTD
-

March 2007 to Present

Project: PY-1, On Shore Gas Processing Facility, Thirukadayur. 
Code of Practice: Indian Standard Codes (Latest revision) 
 
Responsibility held: 
• Coordination in Procurement of Lands and obtaining Government Approvals 
• Construction of canal over crossing bridge for public Road with a span of 21 m. 
• Inspection & Certification of all civil / structural works like storage tanks (Oil & fire water), Processing units, Plant buildings (Substation, Generator Building, Control Room, Operator cabin etc.), Non - Plant Buildings (Admin., Canteen, Fire station, Laboratory, Security, workshop, ware house etc.), Pipe racks, Roads (3 KM), Drains, Fabrication & Erection inspection for Pipe racks, Flare structure (30 m), Helipad, Weigh bridge (40T), Truck loading gantry, Contaminated water treatment package, Produced water treatment package, Piling (cast in situ - 960 Nos) etc. 
• Inspection & Certification of all civil QC, Test Reports, MTC Documents. 
• Liasoning with Local Administrations & for smooth functioning of Plant. 
• Certifying of EPC Contractors RA Bills.

PPN Power Generating Company
-
(T.N), IN
-

December 2005 to January 2007

Project: 330 CCMW Power Projects, Thirukkadaiyur (T.N) 
 
Responsibility held: 
 
• Erection GBCS foundation & Building. 
• Execution of HRSG Blow down sump constructions & App Roads Drain steams. 
• Execution CWPH foundations & drains. 
• Execution of all civil & Structural work like Workshop, Roads, UG & AG Water storage tanks, Plant Buildings etc. 
• Preparation of sub contractor and client's bill. 
• Preparation of all QC documents, Test Reports etc.

Asst. Engineer (CIVIL)

MW BHEL
-
Neyveli, Tamil Nadu
-

January 2004 to December 2005

Responsibility held: 
• Execution of Residential colony of 5 blocks (25 Houses) with all allied facility like roads, Water, Fire fighting, street lights etc. and Admin., Canteen buildings. 
• Preparation of all QC documents, Test Reports etc. 
• Preparation of sub contractor and client's bill.

Technical Assistant

Brothers Engineers & Erectors (P) Ltd
-

April 2002 to April 2003

Project: 330MW PPN Power Generating Company (p) Limited 
: Thirukkaiyur. 
 
Responsibility held: 
 
• Study of drawings and layout 
• Working out of actual quantity involved 
• Preparation of sub - contractor bills 
• Checking of various civil activities 
• Preparation of bar bending schedule, shuttering material requirements / fabrication drawings etc. 
• Arrangement of labour force and material for the execution of projects

Technical Assistant

Tamilnadu
-
Kattumannarkoil, TAMIL NADU, IN
-

May 2001 to December 2002

Project: Veeranam tank project 
 
Responsibility held: 
 
• Execution of canal lining works for about 30 Km with PCC pre cast units. 
• Formation of bund, Construction of culverts (8 Nos) etc.

Skills

BUDGET (Less than 1 year), CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT (Less than 1 year), COST TRACKING (Less than 1 year), DEPLOYMENT (Less than 1 year), LOGGING (Less than 1 year)

Additional Information

Key Qualifications: 
A dynamic professional with 4Years of rich extensive experience in Construction sector. Deft in preparing manpower & equipment deployment schedule & reports, Expertise in liaising with Sub Contractors for timely implementation of works and milestones. Proficient in monitoring the progress, identifying shortfalls, suggesting recovery plans. Adept in inspecting and reviewing projects to monitor compliance with safety codes & other regulations. Expert with preparing and submitting bills, progress and cost tracking reports. Excellent relationship management, analytical and negotiation skills. 
 
Core Competencies: 
 
Planning: 
Maintaining & preparing work force projections, tracking & reporting scope changes, project schedule, and budget.Assisting in the preparation of performance measures, logging and tracking work requests and completed tasks & representing the Construction Division at schedule meetings to coordinate the schedule with the subcontractors. Evaluating design changes and their effects on the project schedule. 
Generating all reports required by the management and the client. 
 
Construction Management: 
Developing site organization to suit the project needs; selecting construction methodology & implementation. Deploying suitable manpower and equipments/ materials and handle properly. Anchoring on-site construction activities to ensure completion of project within the time & cost parameters and effective resource utilization to maximize the output.

Excellent relationship management, analytical and negotiation skills.\xa0', '\xa0', 'Core Competencies:\xa0', '\xa0', 'Planning:\xa0', 'Maintaining & preparing work force projections, tracking & reporting scope changes, project schedule, and budget.Assisting in the preparation of performance measures, logging and tracking work requests and completed tasks & representing the Construction Division at schedule meetings to coordinate the schedule with the subcontractors. Evaluating design changes and their effects on the project schedule.\xa0', 'Generating all reports required by the management and the client.\xa0', '\xa0', 'Construction Management:\xa0', 'Developing site organization to suit the project needs; selecting construction methodology & implementation. Deploying suitable manpower and equipments/ materials and handle properly. Anchoring on-site construction activities to ensure completion of project within the time & cost parameters and effective resource utilization to maximize the output.']

column3:
Golf Garden

Civil Lawyer - Alipore Judges' Court

Kolkata, West Bengal

-

Work Experience

Civil Lawyer

Alipore Judges' Court
-
Alipore, WEST BENGAL, IN
-

2005 to Present

under the guidance of Mr. S. S. Mukherjee, former District Judge and at present Senior Counsel in Alipore Judges' Court. 
 
SPECIALTY: Litigation based on Civil Law. 
 
MEMBERSHIP: Bar Association, Alipore Judges' 
Court 
 
EXPECTED SALARY: Negotiable 
 
RESPONSIBILITIES 
-Assist Senior Lawyers in preparing drafts of suits 
-Preparation of all legal documents 
 
OBJECTIVE 
To give sincere and devoted efforts towards any work assigned to me and to fulfill every requirement of my company where innovation, education and sense of ownership are valued and encouraged 
 
KEY AREAS OF EXPERTISE AND INTEREST 
1. Civil Procedure Code\ 
2. Hindu Marriage Law 
3. Premises Tenancy Act

Junior Civil Lawyer

Alipore Judges' Court
-
Alipore, WEST BENGAL, IN
-

2005 to Present

under the guidance of Mr. S. S. Mukherjee, retired District Judge and a respected Senior Advocate in Alipore Judges' Court. My chief duties and responsibilities include: 
• Study the case of the client and determine which law is applicable to the case in question 
• Evaluate the nature and applications of the law in context of the case 
• Communicate with the client to find out the facts and evidences that will help you make the case stronger 
• Advise the clients on making applications for filing a case and demanding a hearing for the same 
• Maintain confidentiality and protect vital information that may jeopardize the chances of winning the case 
• Summarize the case for clients and judges by highlighting the key highlights of the case 
• Develop strategies, counter answers, and counter allegations to make arguments in court 
• Assist the seniors in preparing gathering evidences and interpreting it for preparing case file 
• Provide suggestions and opinions on ways of fighting the legal battle and making/defying allegations 
• Prepare legal documents that need to be submitted with the court to initiate legal proceedings 
• File cases with the court and receive the appointment for court hearing for the case 
• Conduct mock interviews with the clients and prepare them for the actual trials and interrogations 
• Draft different legal documents eg: power-of-attorneys, wills, contracts, affidavits, etc

Independent Legal Practitioner

Alipore Judges' Court, 24 Parganas (South)

Worked as a Civil Lawyer in Alipore Judges' Court since 2005. Have gained experienced on various Sections and Orders of Civil Law, especially litigation based Order 39 Rule 1 and 2 that deals with ad-interim / temporary injunction and Section 38 to 42, Specific Relief Act, deals with permanent injunction. Also worked on Handling Hindu Marriage Act, especially divorce by mutual consent, restitution of conjugal rights, custody of children et cetera. Also worked on some litigation based on West Bengal Premises Tenancy Act.

Education

LL. B.

Dinabandhu Sahoo Law College, Utkal University.

Skills

Drafting, Client Management, Legal Advising

Additional Information

KEY SKILLS 
 
• Familiar with the legal format that is required for drafting documents in lower Courts 
• Abilities in client management and lateral thinking skills 
• Highly skilled at establishing communication and convincing the others about a subject 
• Ability to advise clients on the legal responsibilities and practices 
 
NATURE OF THE WORK: 
 
** Attending cases in lower court (namely, Alipore Judges' Court) 
** Appearing before National Green Tribunal, Eastern Zone 
** Handling matters of Code of Civil Procedure, especially Order 39 Rule 1 & 2 read with Section 151 (temporary/ad-interim injunction) 
** Handling matters relating to permanent injunction of Specific Relief Act 
** Handling matters of Hindu Marriage Law (especially maintenance, divorce, divorce on mutual consent, restitution of conjugal rights etc.) 
** Handling matters relating to protection of the tenant and recovery of tenanted portion by the landlord under Premises Tenancy Act

-
Kalam, Maharashtra

Links

https://www.linkedin.com/in/subham-kundu

Additional Information

Skill Set: AutoCAD, Microsoft Office, Adobe Photoshop, Research 
Communication Rating 
 
English Rating: Good Indian English with Accent 
 
Academic Projects/Training/Curriculum 
 
ISKON Temple Project and Training 
: Experienced daily life as a civil engineer during onsite training.: Learned how to manage even the smallest detail of managing a construction project.: Learned about execution, quality control, survey, and all other departments. 
 
Pile Foundation Training 
 
Soil Mechanics and Foundation Engineering 
: Observed engineers as they made pile foundations and explained the process to us.: Learned the details of installing piles and all the materials necessary to make it.: Compiled my learning into a document and presented it to the class. 
 
: Learned how to determine a soil's property and how to work with it.: Learned how to determine what kind of foundation to build in which type of soil after measuring the bearing capacity and all main properties. 
 
Structure Analysis 
: Learned all the basics about all construction structures.: Learned in more detail about RCC structure and steel structure. 
 
Presentation on Smart Track Systems 
: Researched in depth information I did not know about.: Made a presentation about the information I learned.: Gave the 10 minute presentation, which was well received.

column3:
Sumanta Muduli

CIVIL ENGINEER - M/s Axon Construction Pvt. Ltd., Chennai

Angul, Orissa

-

• An astute civil engineer with rich experience across Project Planning & Execution, Civil Construction Work, Site Activities, Quality Management, Contractor Bill Management. 
• Currently associated with M/s Alstom India Ltd., Kolkata as Civil Engineer. 
• Proficient in execution of site excavation, Foundation, layout, road & bridge construction projects, ground water tank & overhead water tank, RCC superstructures & concreting. 
• Proven competencies in administering site activities and judiciously deploying project resources -men, equipment and materials to achieve desired operational efficiency. 
• Adept in setting up perfect coordination with consultants, architects, subcontractors, suppliers, site engineers, client etc to review work progress and eliminate bottlenecks for smooth project execution. 
• Core capabilities in project execution & planning, scheduling, detailed engineering drawing, bill of materials, technical specifications, quality management etc. to ensure project delivery within defined cost & time parameters. 
• Skilled in implementing quality control system & procedure to ensure strict compliance with defined quality norms. 
• Adequate understanding of the Construction Technology, Industrial Standards, Codes and Health & Safety Norms (HSE Guidelines) 
• Result driven and focused with honest work habits, man-management, time management & leadership skills.

Work Experience

CIVIL ENGINEER

M/s Axon Construction Pvt. Ltd., Chennai
-
Champa, Chhattisgarh
-

September 2013 to Present

Current Project:  
Execution of Civil works of T.G Power House Structure of 4X360 MW Coal based Thermal Power Plant at R.K.M Powergen Pvt. Ltd., Ucchpinda Village, Janjgir, Champa District, Chhattisgarh. 
 
Responsibility: 
• To plan, execute & supervise all civil related activities of the plant area as per drawing. 
• Checking and processing all venders’ bills in time with detail checking of measurements / quantities and ensuring compliance with the approved technical specifications and designs. 
• To manage watch on working of all the technical/non-technical staffs & gets maximum output from them. To establish good relation with contractors, solve their difficulties so as to achieve smooth working. 
• Monitoring progress report and liaison with contractors for procurement of materials, labours and equipment. 
• To observe strictly safety, quality and environment measures at site. 
• Reconciliation of BOQ. 
• Carrying out pre inspections and also final inspections. 
• The constant monitoring of the project work and also ongoing cost control. 
• Maintaining non-conformance / non-compliance records and logs.

CIVIL ENGINEER

M/s ALSTOM India Ltd (ECS Division), On behalf of Genius Consultants Ltd, Kolkata,WB
-
Jharsuguda, Orissa
-

November 2011 to August 2013

Project Handled : Execution of Civil work of Gas Treatment Centre No. 1&2 of 0.36 MMTPA Aluminium Smelter, including Blower Room, Silos, Bag filter, I.D Fan, Chimney (100mtr –With Erection & Dismantling of top platform of Chimney, Concreting, Inside Firebrick Lining), P.D.S Foundations & other ancillaries related to these with both shallow & deep foundation, at Aditya Aluminium Project, Lapanga, Sambalpur, Odisha. 
 
Responsibility: 
• To plan, execute & supervise all civil related activities of the plant area as per drawing. 
• To manage watch on working of all the technical/non-technical staffs & gets maximum output from them. To establish good relation with contractors, solve their difficulties so as to achieve smooth working. 
• Checking and processing all venders’ bills in time with detail checking of measurements / quantities and ensuring compliance with the approved technical specifications and designs. 
• Monitoring progress report and liaison with contractors for procurement of materials, labour and equipment. 
• To observe strictly safety, quality and environment measures at site. 
• Reconciliation of BOQ. 
• Carrying out pre inspections and also final inspections. 
• Liaison with engineers, designers, contractors and suppliers. 
• The constant monitoring of the project work and also ongoing cost control. 
• Maintaining non-conformance / non-compliance records and logs.

Civil Engineer

M/s Brahma Iron & Power Ltd., Lapanga, Sambalpur,Odisha
-
Sambalpur, Orissa
-

November 2010 to September 2011

Project Handled : Execution of entire Civil work of 9MVAx3 nos Ferro Furnace along with Furnace Building, Crane Bay, Metal Processing Bay, Pollution Control Equipments, Cooling Tower, Pump House, Raw water Reservoir Tank, Raw Material Handling System and other works like workshop, administrative building, stores, internal roads, drainage system and canteen. 
 
Responsibility: 
• Supervising & planning of construction work as per drawings. 
• Leveling and Layout making at site as per drawings. 
• Managing overall project activities including project planning, execution, scheduling and resource allocation of men, material, machine and money to maximize operational efficiency. 
• Formulating plans for effective construction management, including the control of site progress, resolutions of site problems, control of site meetings and coordinating activities of project team. 
• Facilitating effective materials management and inventory control to maintain smooth flow of materials for construction with minimum inventory holding. 
• Monitoring safety of construction projects and devising plans to ensure safety & security of men & other materials. 
• Checking and processing all vendors’ bills in time with detail checking of measurements / quantities and ensuring compliance with the approved technical specifications and designs. 
• Monitoring progress report & liaison with contractors for procurement of materials, labour and equipment. 
• Reviewing the operational practices, identified the areas of obstruction / quality failures and advised on system and process changes for qualitative improvement in productivity. 
• Preparing commercial offers / proposals along with handling contracts billing related formalities & documentation. 
• Identifying critical issues related to site activities and ensuring timely resolution of queries so as to ascertain uninterrupted construction works.

SITE ENGINEER

M/s Modi Projects Ltd., Kanke Road, Ranchi
-
Angul, Orissa
-

April 2010 to October 2010

Project Handled: Execution of PSC Girder Bridge, Hume Pipe Bridge, Box Culvert Bridge and Road Over Bridge for railway line project at Bhushan Steel & Power, Kantabania, Dhenkanal, Odisha. 
Execution of PSC Girder Bridge and Road Over Bridge for Govt. railway line project at Rourkela site, Odisha. 
 
Responsibility: 
• To plan, execute and supervise all civil related construction works as per drawings. 
• Material planning, quality of work certification and measurement of bill. 
• Leveling and Layout making at site as per drawings. 
• Monitoring safety of construction projects and devising plans to ensure safety & security of men & other materials. 
• Directing tasks to a multi-disciplined team of staff.

column11:
Sumanta Muduli

CIVIL ENGINEER - M/s Axon Construction Pvt. Ltd., Chennai

Angul, Orissa

-

• An astute civil engineer with rich experience across Project Planning & Execution, Civil Construction Work, Site Activities, Quality Management, Contractor Bill Management. 
• Currently associated with M/s Alstom India Ltd., Kolkata as Civil Engineer. 
• Proficient in execution of site excavation, Foundation, layout, road & bridge construction projects, ground water tank & overhead water tank, RCC superstructures & concreting. 
• Proven competencies in administering site activities and judiciously deploying project resources -men, equipment and materials to achieve desired operational efficiency. 
• Adept in setting up perfect coordination with consultants, architects, subcontractors, suppliers, site engineers, client etc to review work progress and eliminate bottlenecks for smooth project execution. 
• Core capabilities in project execution & planning, scheduling, detailed engineering drawing, bill of materials, technical specifications, quality management etc. to ensure project delivery within defined cost & time parameters. 
• Skilled in implementing quality control system & procedure to ensure strict compliance with defined quality norms. 
• Adequate understanding of the Construction Technology, Industrial Standards, Codes and Health & Safety Norms (HSE Guidelines) 
• Result driven and focused with honest work habits, man-management, time management & leadership skills.

column3:
Rakesh Kunwar

Hotel Manager - Radisson Blu Resort & Spa

Kolkata, West Bengal

-

With the principal of attitude governs the altitude, I always wish to work with commitment, dedication and loyalty in the challenging and competitive environment to enhance the quality of my life & professionalism & to be a part of organization where emphasis is on career and not just job, with an objective to take an active part in growth and development of the organization.

Work Experience

Hotel Manager

Radisson Blu Resort & Spa
-
Karjat, Maharashtra
-

November 2017 to Present

Karjat 
(It is a 161 Keys - 5 Star Luxury Hotel with 4 F&B Outlets & 8 Banquet Spaces operating under Carlson Rezidor Hotel Group) 
RESPONSIBILITIES & ASSIGNMENTS 
 
Department/Operational Responsibilities 
• Ensures smooth running of the entire hotel operations. 
• Responsible for the P&L of the hotel, staff and business partners along with maintaining the relationship with owning company. 
• Develops effective relationship with guest, local community, local authorities, intermediaries and travel agent in order to create optimal business opportunities and community relation for the hotel. 
• Chairs all monthly departmental meetings (DCC) where all the Team Members could express themselves and give new ideas for improvement in Operations, Guest Experience & Revenues. 
• Keeps all the HODs notified of any fluctuations in business levels, market scenario, special guests, groups, etc. 
• Responsible for the presentation, preparation and application of the annual budgets, forecasts, replacements and investments planning. 
• Maintains careful control over cost & wastages in entire hotel such as payroll, equipments, supplies, etc. 
• Ensures that Gross Operating Profit is achieved by total expense monitoring along with utmost customer satisfaction. 
• Approves rebates, discount, complimentary, up-grades and room rates according to the organizational policies and procedures. 
• Thorough knowledge of Revenue, People & Time Management. 
• Ensures all the policies and procedures manual (SOP), service standards, tasks list and job descriptions are complete and kept up-to-date at all time. 
• Ensures all statutory compliances are completed and kept up to date. 
• Ensures credit policies are sincerely followed as per company norms. 
• Ensures that all potential and hazards reported are actioned immediately.

Hotel Manager

Royal Orchid Resort & Convention Center
-
Bengaluru, Karnataka
-

January 2017 to October 2017

Bengaluru 
(It is a 54 Keys - Upscale Resort with 4 F&B Outlets & 10 Banquet Spaces managed by Royal Orchid Hotels Ltd.)

Rooms Division Manager

Radisson Blu Hotel
-
Indore, Madhya Pradesh
-

March 2014 to January 2017

Indore 
(It is a 200 Keys - 5 Star Luxury Hotel operating under Carlson Rezidor Hotel Group)

Rooms Division Manager

The Pride Hotel
-
Ahmedabad, Gujarat
-

June 2012 to February 2014

Ahmedabad 
(It is a 164 Keys - 5 Star Luxury Hotel. Member of Great Hotels Of The World)

Front Office Manager in The Park

Apeejay Surendra Park Hotel
-
Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra
-

May 2010 to May 2012

It is a 80 Keys - 5 Star boutique property. Member of Design Hotels and an Apeejay Surendra Park Hotel)

Front Office Manager

Munyonyo Commonwealth Resort
-
Kampala, UG
-

April 2008 to April 2010

Kampala (Uganda) 
(The property has hosted CHOGM Meeting with 52 Head of States. It has 449 Keys - Largest hotel in East Africa)

Duty Manager

Al Hamra Fort Hotel & Beach Resort
-

March 2006 to March 2008

Ras Al Khaimah (U.A.E) and promoted as Asst. Front Office Manager in June 2007 
(A Five Star Deluxe Hotel with 489 Keys - Member of Great Hotels Of The World)

Front Office Assistant

Trident Hilton Jaipur & Trident Hilton Agra
-

December 2003 to February 2006

An unit of Oberoi Group of Hotel) 
 
Training & Induction: - 
• Actively involved in organizing different training program along with sub-ordinates. 
• Designing & Implementation of External Training Procedure. 
• Coordination & data maintenance of all kind of Internal as well as external Training programs. 
• Designing & Implementation of Training Calendar. 
 
PROJECT/TRAINING UNDERTAKEN 
• Attended "Train The Trainer" sessions as per Brand standards. 
• "Revenue Management" workshop at Apeejay Institute Of Hospitality, Navi Mumbai. 
• "Certified Departmental Trainer" (C.D.T) at the Trident Hilton Jaipur. 
• Attended "Revenue Management" workshop at CIS Sohna Road by Neil Corr (IDeaS) 
• Nominated as HiPo (High Potential) candidate for the Carlson Senior Leadership Programme at Radisson Blu Hotel, Indore.

Education

Bachelors in Hospitality Management in Hospitality Science

IHMCTAN Kolkata
-
Kolkata, West Bengal

HOTEL MANAGER

Thiruvarur, Tamil Nadu

-

Work Experience

HOTEL MANAGER

Jallikattu Restaurant
-
Kumbakonam, Tamil Nadu
-

March 2014 to November 2016

mar 2017 to Apr 2017) 
Overseeing a team of staff and take responsibility for the smooth running of the hotel, party hall and also it's profitability. In overall charge of daily operations of all departments. 
 
Duties: 
• Effectively managing the daily operations of the hotel. 
• Making sure that guests have a good first and last impression of the hotel. 
• Setting sales targets for staff and monitoring them to ensure that they are met. 
• Recruiting staff, training them up and then monitoring their performance. 
• Engaging and motivating staff to do better. 
• Constantly focusing on profitability and growth. 
• Striving to create a relaxing and welcoming ambience for customers. 
• Identifying other revenue stream opportunities. 
• Organising conferences, wedding receptions and banquets. 
• Launching local publicity campaigns and attending networking events. 
• Making sure presentation, recipes and services are consistent throughout the hotel. 
• Demonstrating visible operational leadership and management to the hotel staff.

Production Engineering Technician

Flextronics
-
Singapore
-

July 2006 to June 2013

Department: Logistics & Production Planning Dept 
 
Specializations in career: 
 
LOGISTICS SPECIALIST: 
1. Over 6.9 years of experience in logistics, Warehouse and transportation field 
2. Track record of clearly defining special instructions or equipment required on bill of lading or electronic shipment tenders 
3. Comprehensive knowledge of providing customer service to assigned base of accounts and preparing packing/shipping documents 
4. Capable of systematically reviewing part characteristics and recommending alternatives or replacement components 
5. Hands on experience in identifying equipment deficiencies, coordinating requirements with the established shippers and creating billing documents 
6. Compile detailed worksheets and specifications from customer orders. 
7. Using FIFO method for material supply and produce the monthly reports of slow moving entries 
8. Co-ordinate and monitor the movement of parts, supplies and materials within an establishment and ensure that supplies, materials and products are shipped and received on schedule. 
9. Anticipated raw material requirements through the generation of a Materials Requirement Plan (MRP) 
10. Prepare and maintain various reports on the progress of work, materials used, rates of production and other production information, using manual or computerized systems (ERP) 
a. (A) . Forecast all material requirements utilizing Bills-of-Materials (BOM) 
b. (B) . Prepare Monthly Forecast for purchasing material & packaging material 
11. Inventory control 
12. Customer HP, AVAYA, CISCO, MESSIER-BUGATTI (Aerospace), etc 
13. Good Knowledge about clean room, kaizan, 5s & safety working place

Skills

CUSTOMER SERVICE (6 years), LOGISTICS (6 years), PACKING (6 years), RECEPTIONIST (6 years), RETAIL SALES (6 years)

Links

http://www.Flextronics.com

Additional Information

AREAS OF EXPERTISE: 
 
1. Exceedingly capable of performing analytical review of requirements with source documents such as technical orders and manuals to determine applicability 
2. Outstandingly skilled in assisting the logistics department with planning, packing and shipping of support items 
3. Remarkably observant in determining customer requirements, accurately updating receipts and shipping information into appropriate warehouse systems 
4. Demonstrated capability of developing and maintaining excellent customer service to internal/external customers 
5. Well acquainted with providing support for new logistics training, inspections, and other logistics actions

column3:
Rajneesh Singh

Deputy General Manager - Administration & Travel Management - Akar Impex Pvt. Ltd

Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh

-

Self motivated professional with over 15 years of experience in managing Hotel & Transport 
vendor procurement for Aviation, IT & waste water treatment plant industry. 
Specialized in vendor procurement (Supplier Market Research, RFQ management, Bid 
management, Evaluate negotiate and award contract), Strategic sourcing, vendor 
management, SLA monitoring (Supplier performance Management), Contract compliance and 
savings validation.

Work Experience

Deputy General Manager - Administration & Travel Management

Akar Impex India Pvt. Ltd
-
Noida, Uttar Pradesh
-

July 2016 to Present

AKAR IMPEX (P) LIMITED is a well-known name in India and now in many parts of the world in the environment sector in general and waste water treatment in particular. The company provides 
consultancy, manufactures equipment and executes Turn Key Projects in the field of Waste 
Water treatment, Sewage treatment, Water treatment and Municipal Solid Waste Composting 
Plants. Akar is an ISO 9001: 2010certified. It has already developed into an exporting company and is fairly well known in the Middle East, Asian and some of the African countries. Akar has 
exported to Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, UAE, Jordan, Nepal, Sudan and many other countries. 
➢ Coverage/Control Areas:: India & Overseas 
• Administration & Travel Operations Management 
1. Defining & controlling processes - Gap Analysis, design & implement better 
process. 
2. Identifying system shortcomings and respond to operational and emergency 
situations. 
3. Control & Management of Security of premises & employees on duty. 
4. Ensuring Standard Operating Procedures are in place for Administration & Travel. 
5. Managing Travel of employees, clients & vendors (Hotel bookings, Facilities, 
Security, Cafeteria, Building Maintenance & Transport) 
6. Venue Management for Conferences, Seminars, Corporate Celebrations, 
Interviews, Trainings, Regional Operations Meet & Annual General Meeting. 
7. Develop & implement innovative programs & processes that ensure optimization of costs & resources. 
8. Responsible for alignment of resources as per the requirement of projects & the skill set. 
9. Review reports for cleaning & Hygiene activities are undertaken in accordance with the schedule. Ensure implementation & management of Risk & Safety 
procedures to ensure uninterrupted operations. 
10. Managing office supplies for smooth functioning of different departments. 
11. Manage trainings for on-site teams on House Keeping standards/procedures & implementation. Conducting regular audits to ensure the procedures are being 
followed & updated. 
12. Coordination with Operations Team to ensure smooth working environment for operations. 
13. Ensure regular monitoring on quality of services being provided by the third-party as per the agreed SLA's. 
14. Responsible for Hiring of resources for open positions or any additional 
requirements for Administration department. 
15. Responsible for training & refresher of resources. 
16. Responsible for the KRA assessment (appraisals) of Administration department. 
 
• Vendor Procurement - Accountability of process control & management 
 
1. Management of procurement on New supplier development. 
2. RFQ Release - Invitation for bidding is released for the vendors to quote for the services. 
3. Providing Service Understanding to Vendor & Close Financial Negotiation - 
Discussion with the vendor & ensure complete understanding with the vendors about of required services. The financials negotiations are taken up on the basis of required services. The rates are closed with the vendors for comparison. 
4. Comparison - Commercials from all the vendors. 
5. Analyze prices quoted by suppliers, search for alternate suppliers if needed and look for options to reduce cost. 
6. Assessment - Vendor Capability for required services (Background Check & Financial Standing) 
7. Vendor Induction planning, management & control. 
8. Strengthening existing vendor source & developing alternate source of suppliers. 
9. Controlling strategic sourcing process to ensure management of change in cost & resource according to the market. 
 
• Vendor Relationship Management 
 
1. Review/Feedback - Conducting weekly & monthly review meetings with vendors to ensure discussion on performance, coordination, support & improve the delivery, quality and supply chain. 
2. Conducting, evaluation & publishing of supplier performance feedback 
scorecard & perform vice versa exercise of obtaining supplier feedback about user. 
 
• Billing/Invoicing 
 
1. Invoice validations for Hotels, Guest Houses, housekeeping, Security, Electricity, 
Building Maintenance, Cafeteria & Transport. 
2. Ensuring dispute/query resolution on invoices for billing team. 
• MIS Management 
 
1. MIS Management for Timesheet, facilities, travel expenses (Air/Train/Bus), 
Employee - Fuel Reimbursement, transportation & hotel/guest house 
accommodation. 
2. Dashboard Presentation to management on admin operations as per below schedule. 
✓ Weekly Reports 
✓ Monthly Reports 
✓ Quarterly Reports 
✓ Half Yearly Reports 
✓ Annual Reports

Senior Manager - Administration

Spicejet Ltd
-
Gurgaon, Haryana
-

July 2012 to July 2016

SpiceJet is a low-cost airline headquartered in Gurgaon, India. It began service in May 2005, and by February 2016, it has become the fourth largest airline in the country by number of passengers carried, with a market share of 13.1%. Spicejet(with over 5500 employees) operates aircraft configured with a single passenger class. Along with passenger services, Spicejet also offers cargo services on the same flights. The service is available on flights connecting Ahmedabad, Agartala, Amritsar, Bagdogra, Bengaluru, Chennai, Coimbatore, Delhi, Goa, Guwahati, Hyderabad, Jaipur, Kochi, Kolkata, Madurai, Mumbai, Pune, Visakhapatnam, Tuticorin and few international cities. Between 3 to 5 tons of cargo is ferried on each flight ensuring maximum utilization of the aircraft. 
 Coverage/Control Areas :: Network-wide Administration, Vendor procurement & Management. 
 No. of VendorsManaged :: 72 
 Total Billing :: Approx. 65 Crores (Yearly) 
 Total Savings :: Approx. 14 Crores (Yearly) 
 
Job Responsibilities:- 
• Administrations Operations Management 
1. Defining & controlling processes – Gap Analysis, design & implement better process. 
2. Monitoring daily activities of Traveldesk, Network-wide hotels/transport & Travel of SpiceJet Pilots, Cabin Crew, Engineers, Doctors & other staff. 
3. Control & Management of hotel bookings for Pilots/Cabin Crew as per their flight schedule acrossthe network for Non-base Pilots/Cabin Crew to any city. 
4. Control & Management of transportation for Pilots/Cabin Crew as per their flight schedule acrossthe network for base Pilots/Cabin Crew to any city. 
5. Management of security of employees & ensuring QRT is at toes with alerts. 
6. Management of Airline tickets, Travel Insurance & VISA for operational & non-operationalrequirement for employees across network. 
7. Venue Management for Conferences, Seminars, Corporate Celebrations, Station Manager’s Meet, Interviews, Trainings, Regional Operations Meet & Annual General Meeting. 
8. Responsible for Hiring of resources for Administration department. 
9. Responsible for the yearly performance assessment of Administration team members. 
 
• Vendor Procurement (Manual) - Initiating & controlling the procurement process of Hotel & Transport vendors. 
1. Prepare procurement plan based on user requirement & trend analysis. 
2. RFQ Release - Invitation for bidding to the vendors for quoting rates for services. 
3. Assessment – The assessment of vendors for required services is carried out to understand the capability of vendors (Background Check & Financial Standing). 
4. Providing Service Understanding to Vendor & Closing Financial Negotiation – Discussion with vendor to ensure complete understanding of the required services. The financial negotiations are closed & the comparison chart is finalized. 
5. Comparison – The negotiated Commercials from all the vendors are compared & the best 03 vendors are assessed for final closure of contracting process. 
6. Vendor Induction – Transition planning& management with Admin Team &parallel control on vendor induction. 
 
• Vendor e-Procurement - Leading the e-procurement Team (ARIBA) to monitor & control online bidding process for Hotels (PAN India/Overseas & Transport. 
SAP ARIBA Implementation & Adoption :-Process design, Training of internal stakeholders, Designing Contract Templates, Workflows matrixes, Compliance to Financial & Legal requirements. 
1. RFQ Release - Invitation for bidding to the vendors for quoting rates for services. 
2. Assessment – The assessment of vendor capability for required services is carried out to understand the capability of vendors (Background Check & Financial Standing). 
3. Providing Service Understanding to Vendor– Discussion with vendor to ensure they have the complete understanding of the requirements (services or products).  
4. The vendors are provided with a schedule of bidding with a time defined window to bid for particular contract. The vendors compete online & the lowest bid is awarded with the contract.  
5. Vendor Induction – Transition planning & management with Admin Team 
• Vendor Management – Vendor Relationship Management 
1. End to End Supplier registration & on-boarding. 
2. Creating and managing supplier contracts in the system and responsible for their amendments basis changescontractual terms and conditions 
3. Operational Meetings – Monthly meetings with vendors & Admin Team to understand & resolve the challenges faced by them to ensure continuous operational delivery. 
4. Provide support & training on ARIBA–tool designed specifically for suppliers to submit bids online, participate in RFQ events. 
5. Dispute Resolution – Organize meetings with vendors, Users&finance team to discuss &resolve any issues related to billing & payments. 
 
• MIS Management& Reports 
1. MIS Management for vendor procurement. 
2. MIS Management for Issues & resolutions. 
3. Maintaining Bidding Reports of completed procurement projects. 
4. Dashboard Presentation to management on contracts procurement & bidding reports as per below schedule. 
 Monthly Reports 
 Quarterly Reports  
 Half Yearly Reports. 
 Annual Reports.  
 
• Trainings 
1. SAP ARIBA–E-Procurement Tool 
2. CCQA – Cost Control &Quality Analysis 
3. KAIZEN – Process Improvement 
4. SMS – Safety Management Systems 
5. AVSEC–Aviation Security 
6. Service Excellence 
7. Crisis Management

Assistant Manager - Administration

Webridge Infosystems
-
Noida, Uttar Pradesh
-

March 2008 to July 2012

Webridge Technologies, Inc. is a total software development and an IT consulting company which has combined expertise on both fronts. Webridge is in the business of helping its customers function more productively and profitably through a full range of specialized staffing and project implementation products and services. We deliver qualified consultants and project Managers for both contract and ongoing requirements across all science and technology disciplines. Webridge has been providing superior information technology talent and solutions to private and public sector clients in the USA. Our reputation as an IT expert is built on many decades of management experience as a full-spectrum source for the IT community.  
• Contract Negotiations, Vendor Management & billing coordination. 
• Coordinating for various MIS to ensure timely reporting to the senior management. 
• Responsible for Administration & Facilities for close to 200 employees at Noida which includes General Administration, Facilities Management-Infrastructure Maintenance, Logistics, Transport, Canteen & Resource Management. 
• Client Interaction, Arranging the logistics etc. for the various Client visits. 
• Responsible for Physical Security, Disaster Management and Inventory Management. 
• Organizing Meetings for onshore & offshore management. 
• Streamlining all telecom related issues. Negotiating (Best rates) and Dealing with all telecom companies like Airtel, Reliance, Vodafone and BSNL regarding all type of new connections, billing issues, service related issues. 
• Hotel / Guest house arrangements for clients/customers and outstation employees 
• SPOC for Inter department correspondence for the Admin team. 
• Management of office administration for smooth day to day functioning of the office. 
• Organizing Meetings for onshore & offshore management. 
• Ensuring travel arrangements and hotel bookings for tours of consultants (software developers based out in USA). 
• Hotel bookings for consultants (software developers) in USA.  
• Managing the offshore & onshore correspondence.

Officer - Administration

Akar Impex India Pvt. Ltd.
-
Noida, Uttar Pradesh
-

September 2002 to March 2008

AKAR IMPEX (P) LIMITED is a well-known name in India and now in many parts of the world in the environment sector in general and waste water treatment in particular. The company provides consultancy, manufactures equipment and executes Turn Key Projects in the field of Waste Water treatment, Sewage treatment, Water treatment and Municipal Solid Waste Composting Plants. Akar is an ISO 9001 :2010certified. It has already developed into an exporting company and is fairly well known in the Middle East, Asian and some of the African countries. Akar has exported to Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, UAE, Jordan, Nepal, Sudan and many other countries. 
. Vendor identification & invitation for discussion on services for contracts. 
• Management of Appointment Scheduler for the Managing Director. 
• Preparing & providing presentations to offshore & onshore clients. 
• Organizing Meetings (Internal & External) 
• Overall Facilities Management. 
• Following up different departments for reports/data or documentation. 
• Travel arrangements and hotel bookings for domestic/international tours. 
• Management of domestic/international correspondence. 
• Maintaining personal files of all employees. 
• Managementof the day to day administration work of the office.

Education

MBA in Financial Management

Annamalai University
-
Chennai, Tamil Nadu

Bachelor in Tourism Studies

IGNOU
-
New Delhi, Delhi

Skills

APPLICATION SOFTWARE (Less than 1 year), EXCEL (Less than 1 year), MICROSOFT WINDOWS (Less than 1 year), OUTLOOK (Less than 1 year), WORD (Less than 1 year)

Additional Information

Technical Skills: 
 
Operating System: Microsoft Windows 
Application Software: MS-Office (MS-Excel, MS-Word, MS Power Point, Outlook), Skype.

Rajneesh Singh

Deputy General Manager - Administration & Travel Management - Akar Impex Pvt. Ltd

Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh

-

Self motivated professional with over 15 years of experience in managing Hotel & Transport 
vendor procurement for Aviation, IT & waste water treatment plant industry. 
Specialized in vendor procurement (Supplier Market Research, RFQ management, Bid 
management, Evaluate negotiate and award contract), Strategic sourcing, vendor 
management, SLA monitoring (Supplier performance Management), Contract compliance and

column12:
Work Experience

Deputy General Manager - Administration & Travel Management

Akar Impex India Pvt. Ltd
-
Noida, Uttar Pradesh
-

July 2016 to Present

AKAR IMPEX (P) LIMITED is a well-known name in India and now in many parts of the world in the environment sector in general and waste water treatment in particular. The company provides 
consultancy, manufactures equipment and executes Turn Key Projects in the field of Waste 
Water treatment, Sewage treatment, Water treatment and Municipal Solid Waste Composting 
Plants. Akar is an ISO 9001: 2010certified. It has already developed into an exporting company and is fairly well known in the Middle East, Asian and some of the African countries. Akar has 
exported to Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, UAE, Jordan, Nepal, Sudan and many other countries. 
➢ Coverage/Control Areas:: India & Overseas 
• Administration & Travel Operations Management 
1. Defining & controlling processes - Gap Analysis, design & implement better 
process. 
2. Identifying system shortcomings and respond to operational and emergency 
situations. 
3. Control & Management of Security of premises & employees on duty. 
4. Ensuring Standard Operating Procedures are in place for Administration & Travel. 
5. Managing Travel of employees, clients & vendors (Hotel bookings, Facilities, 
Security, Cafeteria, Building Maintenance & Transport) 
6. Venue Management for Conferences, Seminars, Corporate Celebrations, 
Interviews, Trainings, Regional Operations Meet & Annual General Meeting. 
7. Develop & implement innovative programs & processes that ensure optimization of costs & resources. 
8. Responsible for alignment of resources as per the requirement of projects & the skill set. 
9. Review reports for cleaning & Hygiene activities are undertaken in accordance with the schedule. Ensure implementation & management of Risk & Safety 
procedures to ensure uninterrupted operations. 
10. Managing office supplies for smooth functioning of different departments. 
11. Manage trainings for on-site teams on House Keeping standards/procedures & implementation. Conducting regular audits to ensure the procedures are being 
followed & updated. 
12. Coordination with Operations Team to ensure smooth working environment for operations. 
13. Ensure regular monitoring on quality of services being provided by the third-party as per the agreed SLA's. 
14. Responsible for Hiring of resources for open positions or any additional 
requirements for Administration department. 
15. Responsible for training & refresher of resources. 
16. Responsible for the KRA assessment (appraisals) of Administration department. 
 
• Vendor Procurement - Accountability of process control & management 
 
1. Management of procurement on New supplier development. 
2. RFQ Release - Invitation for bidding is released for the vendors to quote for the services. 
3. Providing Service Understanding to Vendor & Close Financial Negotiation - 
Discussion with the vendor & ensure complete understanding with the vendors about of required services. The financials negotiations are taken up on the basis of required services. The rates are closed with the vendors for comparison. 
4. Comparison - Commercials from all the vendors. 
5. Analyze prices quoted by suppliers, search for alternate suppliers if needed and look for options to reduce cost. 
6. Assessment - Vendor Capability for required services (Background Check & Financial Standing) 
7. Vendor Induction planning, management & control. 
8. Strengthening existing vendor source & developing alternate source of suppliers. 
9. Controlling strategic sourcing process to ensure management of change in cost & resource according to the market. 
 
• Vendor Relationship Management 
 
1. Review/Feedback - Conducting weekly & monthly review meetings with vendors to ensure discussion on performance, coordination, support & improve the delivery, quality and supply chain. 
2. Conducting, evaluation & publishing of supplier performance feedback 
scorecard & perform vice versa exercise of obtaining supplier feedback about user. 
 
• Billing/Invoicing 
 
1. Invoice validations for Hotels, Guest Houses, housekeeping, Security, Electricity, 
Building Maintenance, Cafeteria & Transport. 
2. Ensuring dispute/query resolution on invoices for billing team. 
• MIS Management 
 
1. MIS Management for Timesheet, facilities, travel expenses (Air/Train/Bus), 
Employee - Fuel Reimbursement, transportation & hotel/guest house 
accommodation. 
2. Dashboard Presentation to management on admin operations as per below schedule. 
✓ Weekly Reports 
✓ Monthly Reports 
✓ Quarterly Reports 
✓ Half Yearly Reports 
✓ Annual Reports

Senior Manager - Administration

Spicejet Ltd
-
Gurgaon, Haryana
-

July 2012 to July 2016

SpiceJet is a low-cost airline headquartered in Gurgaon, India. It began service in May 2005, and by February 2016, it has become the fourth largest airline in the country by number of passengers carried, with a market share of 13.1%. Spicejet(with over 5500 employees) operates aircraft configured with a single passenger class. Along with passenger services, Spicejet also offers cargo services on the same flights. The service is available on flights connecting Ahmedabad, Agartala, Amritsar, Bagdogra, Bengaluru, Chennai, Coimbatore, Delhi, Goa, Guwahati, Hyderabad, Jaipur, Kochi, Kolkata, Madurai, Mumbai, Pune, Visakhapatnam, Tuticorin and few international cities. Between 3 to 5 tons of cargo is ferried on each flight ensuring maximum utilization of the aircraft. 
 Coverage/Control Areas :: Network-wide Administration, Vendor procurement & Management. 
 No. of VendorsManaged :: 72 
 Total Billing :: Approx. 65 Crores (Yearly) 
 Total Savings :: Approx. 14 Crores (Yearly) 
 
Job Responsibilities:- 
• Administrations Operations Management 
1. Defining & controlling processes – Gap Analysis, design & implement better process. 
2. Monitoring daily activities of Traveldesk, Network-wide hotels/transport & Travel of SpiceJet Pilots, Cabin Crew, Engineers, Doctors & other staff. 
3. Control & Management of hotel bookings for Pilots/Cabin Crew as per their flight schedule acrossthe network for Non-base Pilots/Cabin Crew to any city. 
4. Control & Management of transportation for Pilots/Cabin Crew as per their flight schedule acrossthe network for base Pilots/Cabin Crew to any city. 
5. Management of security of employees & ensuring QRT is at toes with alerts. 
6. Management of Airline tickets, Travel Insurance & VISA for operational & non-operationalrequirement for employees across network. 
7. Venue Management for Conferences, Seminars, Corporate Celebrations, Station Manager’s Meet, Interviews, Trainings, Regional Operations Meet & Annual General Meeting. 
8. Responsible for Hiring of resources for Administration department. 
9. Responsible for the yearly performance assessment of Administration team members. 
 
• Vendor Procurement (Manual) - Initiating & controlling the procurement process of Hotel & Transport vendors. 
1. Prepare procurement plan based on user requirement & trend analysis. 
2. RFQ Release - Invitation for bidding to the vendors for quoting rates for services. 
3. Assessment – The assessment of vendors for required services is carried out to understand the capability of vendors (Background Check & Financial Standing). 
4. Providing Service Understanding to Vendor & Closing Financial Negotiation – Discussion with vendor to ensure complete understanding of the required services. The financial negotiations are closed & the comparison chart is finalized. 
5. Comparison – The negotiated Commercials from all the vendors are compared & the best 03 vendors are assessed for final closure of contracting process. 
6. Vendor Induction – Transition planning& management with Admin Team &parallel control on vendor induction. 
 
• Vendor e-Procurement - Leading the e-procurement Team (ARIBA) to monitor & control online bidding process for Hotels (PAN India/Overseas & Transport. 
SAP ARIBA Implementation & Adoption :-Process design, Training of internal stakeholders, Designing Contract Templates, Workflows matrixes, Compliance to Financial & Legal requirements. 
1. RFQ Release - Invitation for bidding to the vendors for quoting rates for services. 
2. Assessment – The assessment of vendor capability for required services is carried out to understand the capability of vendors (Background Check & Financial Standing). 
3. Providing Service Understanding to Vendor– Discussion with vendor to ensure they have the complete understanding of the requirements (services or products).  
4. The vendors are provided with a schedule of bidding with a time defined window to bid for particular contract. The vendors compete online & the lowest bid is awarded with the contract.  
5. Vendor Induction – Transition planning & management with Admin Team 
• Vendor Management – Vendor Relationship Management 
1. End to End Supplier registration & on-boarding. 
2. Creating and managing supplier contracts in the system and responsible for their amendments basis changescontractual terms and conditions 
3. Operational Meetings – Monthly meetings with vendors & Admin Team to understand & resolve the challenges faced by them to ensure continuous operational delivery. 
4. Provide support & training on ARIBA–tool designed specifically for suppliers to submit bids online, participate in RFQ events. 
5. Dispute Resolution – Organize meetings with vendors, Users&finance team to discuss &resolve any issues related to billing & payments. 
 
• MIS Management& Reports 
1. MIS Management for vendor procurement. 
2. MIS Management for Issues & resolutions. 
3. Maintaining Bidding Reports of completed procurement projects. 
4. Dashboard Presentation to management on contracts procurement & bidding reports as per below schedule. 
 Monthly Reports 
 Quarterly Reports  
 Half Yearly Reports. 
 Annual Reports.  
 
• Trainings 
1. SAP ARIBA–E-Procurement Tool 
2. CCQA – Cost Control &Quality Analysis 
3. KAIZEN – Process Improvement 
4. SMS – Safety Management Systems 
5. AVSEC–Aviation Security 
6. Service Excellence 
7. Crisis Management

column3:
Dipak Kumar

Golf Support Executive in Golf Operation Sales & Marketing

Gurgaon, Haryana

-

Work Experience

Admin officer

Great Lakes Institute Of Management

Admin related work, transport, Store, Purchase,Bills processing, Vendor management, mainrenance if campus, duty roaster,attendance,amc's, flight hotel bookings, petty cash handling

Golf Support Executive in Golf Operation Sales & Marketing

ITC Classic Golf & Country Club
-

November 2014 to August 2015

Work Description:- 
On Weekday:- 
• Checking in the towels are fresh and available at health club. 
• Checking the music is Playing well through the Clubhouse. 
• Looking after the mails and put the dates for updating Golf Calendar. 
• Assisting and Co-coordinating with the staff. 
• FP (Putting details in the Fps as per the instructions of marketing, and insuring the same has been given to all the concerned departments for the event so that they can prepare well) 
• Making Handicap Certificates of the desired Members after calculation based on USGA. 
• Updating the handicaps of Members on the system on regular basis. 
• Looking after the course (All Bunkers are raked, No Divot n Pitch Mark to be found on the course, refreshment Huts, Washrooms, Greens Etc.) 
 
On Weekend:- 
• Supervising Caddy Major in the morning before tee-off at the time of Dress & Token allotment 
• Performing as a Starter/Marshall as when asked by the Superior or Management. 
• Checking all carts are safe and at the end of the day sent them all to Cart Garage. 
• Assisting in Office when required. 
• Providing Medical Aid as when required On Course. 
• Making sure while marshaling that players move safely between holes, Pathways/Cartpaths are kept Clear, Overseeing the dress code of the Golfers. 
 
Tournament:- 
Before:- 
• Assisting the event management team for branding on Course and on the F&B venue setup. ( On-Course -Tee Boxes, Hoardings, Spot Prizes, etc) 
• Preparing the notice board, Bag tags, Draw, Cart tags, Name Tags. 
• Cart & Caddy Line up before the tournament ( selection & allotment of better caddies) 
• Ensuring carts are cleaned and lined up properly. ( Checking the pin sheet, pencil, Score card) 
• Ensuring allotment of caddie for spot prizes. 
 
After:- 
• Ensuring the details for the spot prize is been filled properly by the caddies allotted for same 
• Replacement of cart & caddy if required 
• Co-coordinating with F&B to ensure the refreshment huts are sufficiently stocked 
• Distribution of food to the on course Marshalls & spot Prize caddies 
• Setting a prize distribution area where prizes to be distributed 
• Assisting event management team in scoring & Prize distribution 
 
Worked at DLF Golf & Country Club As a Golf executive in Golf Operations From August 2015 to August 2016. 
 
Work Description:- 
Working at Multi Positions. 
Managing all Office administration, day to day operation, all correspondence. 
Managed all type of Golf Tournaments inter National Level Level ( Hero Women 
Indian Open 2015) 
Managing Handicapping, Booking of Slots. 
Handling Queries of guests regarding the course and game. 
Making golf billings, settling reports. 
Updating handicap details of golfers on system. 
Doing scoring in corporate tournaments. 
Receiving all corporate clients and assisting them on course. 
Doing bookings and making booking sheets of golfers. 
Solving problems of members & Guests regarding slow play, billings, bookings etc. 
Making mis for meeting with HOD's. 
Any other Duties Given by the Management. 
Overseeing the Golfers During Match Play. 
 
Worked at Great Lakes Institute Of Management as Front Desk & Admin Officer from Aug 2016 till May 2018. 
 
Work Description:- 
Managing the Front Desk, Newspeper & Brochures, Petty Cash. 
Managing the attendance of Housekeeping and Pantry staff. 
Managing front desk/help desk for students and staff members/faculty. 
Maintenance of Records of all incoming and outgoing communications. 
Maintenance of Stores, Toiletries/Pantry/Stationary- computerised XL file in shared 
Google. 
Procurement of Toiletries/Pantry/Stationary after finalization of rate contract. 
Arrange and Maintain transport ( Logistics) for faculty /staff/ guest. 
Monitoring the feedback mechanism both internal ( students and staff) and external 
(vendors) 
Coordination point between Programme office/faculty and students. 
Helping in organise various celebrations inside/outside campus. 
All responsibilities as and when asked by the superiors. 
Cross checking the cleanliness of classrooms and offices. 
Bills processing and follow and follow up for payment. 
Vendor management. 
Maintaining inventory of Pantry and Stationary on monthly basis. 
Tracking and monitoring of Office cabs and outsourced cabs. 
Maintaining the general filing system.

Front Office Executive

Hotel Crestwood
-

July 2013 to July 2014

Work Description:- 
• Managing the front desk 
• Receiving the calls from guests and taking their reservations 
• Doing check-in and checkout 
• Making F&B bills 
• Checking the arrival list and allotting them rooms according to the package 
• Informing the housekeeping department the arrivals and check outs so they can keep the room ready 
• Making FP's and set up the desired area. 
• Making Bills And Doing settlement reports at last.

Education

B.com

Monad

Skills

Admin, Front Desk, Transport, Lohistics, Purchase, maintenance, facilities

Additional Information

Experienced in hospitality, Administration, Front desk, Vendor management,

Work Experience

Admin officer

Great Lakes Institute Of Management

Admin related work, transport, Store, Purchase,Bills processing, Vendor management, mainrenance if campus, duty roaster,attendance,amc's, flight hotel bookings, petty cash handling

Golf Support Executive in Golf Operation Sales & Marketing

ITC Classic Golf & Country Club
-

November 2014 to August 2015

Work Description:- 
On Weekday:- 
• Checking in the towels are fresh and available at health club. 
• Checking the music is Playing well through the Clubhouse. 
• Looking after the mails and put the dates for updating Golf Calendar. 
• Assisting and Co-coordinating with the staff. 
• FP (Putting details in the Fps as per the instructions of marketing, and insuring the same has been given to all the concerned departments for the event so that they can prepare well) 
• Making Handicap Certificates of the desired Members after calculation based on USGA. 
• Updating the handicaps of Members on the system on regular basis. 
• Looking after the course (All Bunkers are raked, No Divot n Pitch Mark to be found on the course, refreshment Huts, Washrooms, Greens Etc.) 
 
On Weekend:- 
• Supervising Caddy Major in the morning before tee-off at the time of Dress & Token allotment 
• Performing as a Starter/Marshall as when asked by the Superior or Management. 
• Checking all carts are safe and at the end of the day sent them all to Cart Garage. 
• Assisting in Office when required. 
• Providing Medical Aid as when required On Course. 
• Making sure while marshaling that players move safely between holes, Pathways/Cartpaths are kept Clear, Overseeing the dress code of the Golfers. 
 
Tournament:- 
Before:- 
• Assisting the event management team for branding on Course and on the F&B venue setup. ( On-Course -Tee Boxes, Hoardings, Spot Prizes, etc) 
• Preparing the notice board, Bag tags, Draw, Cart tags, Name Tags. 
• Cart & Caddy Line up before the tournament ( selection & allotment of better caddies) 
• Ensuring carts are cleaned and lined up properly. ( Checking the pin sheet, pencil, Score card) 
• Ensuring allotment of caddie for spot prizes. 
 
After:- 
• Ensuring the details for the spot prize is been filled properly by the caddies allotted for same 
• Replacement of cart & caddy if required 
• Co-coordinating with F&B to ensure the refreshment huts are sufficiently stocked 
• Distribution of food to the on course Marshalls & spot Prize caddies 
• Setting a prize distribution area where prizes to be distributed 
• Assisting event management team in scoring & Prize distribution 
 
Worked at DLF Golf & Country Club As a Golf executive in Golf Operations From August 2015 to August 2016. 
 
Work Description:- 
Working at Multi Positions. 
Managing all Office administration, day to day operation, all correspondence. 
Managed all type of Golf Tournaments inter National Level Level ( Hero Women 
Indian Open 2015) 
Managing Handicapping, Booking of Slots. 
Handling Queries of guests regarding the course and game. 
Making golf billings, settling reports. 
Updating handicap details of golfers on system. 
Doing scoring in corporate tournaments. 
Receiving all corporate clients and assisting them on course. 
Doing bookings and making booking sheets of golfers. 
Solving problems of members & Guests regarding slow play, billings, bookings etc. 
Making mis for meeting with HOD's. 
Any other Duties Given by the Management. 
Overseeing the Golfers During Match Play. 
 
Worked at Great Lakes Institute Of Management as Front Desk & Admin Officer from Aug 2016 till May 2018. 
 
Work Description:- 
Managing the Front Desk, Newspeper & Brochures, Petty Cash. 
Managing the attendance of Housekeeping and Pantry staff. 
Managing front desk/help desk for students and staff members/faculty. 
Maintenance of Records of all incoming and outgoing communications. 
Maintenance of Stores, Toiletries/Pantry/Stationary- computerised XL file in shared 
Google. 
Procurement of Toiletries/Pantry/Stationary after finalization of rate contract. 
Arrange and Maintain transport ( Logistics) for faculty /staff/ guest. 
Monitoring the feedback mechanism both internal ( students and staff) and external 
(vendors) 
Coordination point between Programme office/faculty and students. 
Helping in organise various celebrations inside/outside campus. 
All responsibilities as and when asked by the superiors. 
Cross checking the cleanliness of classrooms and offices. 
Bills processing and follow and follow up for payment. 
Vendor management. 
Maintaining inventory of Pantry and Stationary on monthly basis. 
Tracking and monitoring of Office cabs and outsourced cabs. 
Maintaining the general filing system.

Front Office Executive

Hotel Crestwood
-

July 2013 to July 2014

Work Description:- 
• Managing the front desk 
• Receiving the calls from guests and taking their reservations 
• Doing check-in and checkout 
• Making F&B bills 
• Checking the arrival list and allotting them rooms according to the package 
• Informing the housekeeping department the arrivals and check outs so they can keep the room ready 
• Making FP's and set up the desired area. 
• Making Bills And Doing settlement reports at last.

column3:
Renu Chauhan

Hotel Management - Birla SunsLife

Rayya, PUNJAB, IN

-

Greatly interested in a commercially challenging career and having a great zeal in developing cutting edge solutions and serve the concern to the best of my potentials and aid the company in reaching its pinnacle of success.

Work Experience

Hotel Management

Birla SunsLife
-

December 2012 to Present

Duration: 2 Months 
Summer Project-" Mutual Funds On Birla Sunslife" 
 
This project I have done in my MBA (Finance Specialization): 
 
Title: Mutual Funds 
Organization: Birla SunsLife 
Duration: 45 DAYS. 
In this project I came to know about the basics of mutual funds, its types and schemes. This project has been great to me to know the concept of mutual fund, its working, and the awareness to customers about mutual fund. There are so many mutual fund companies and asset management companies having experts and professionals to manage the funds and there by minimizing the risk and enhancing peoples' fund. 
4th sem Project- "Preference Of investors towards various investment options " 
 
This project I have done in my MBA (Finance Specialization): 
 
Title: Preference Of investors towards various investment options 
Duration: 1 month 
In this Project I came to know about the nature of Investment that differs from individual to individual and is unique to each one because it depends on various parameters like future financial goals, the present & the future income model, capacity to bear the risk, the present requirements and lot more. The focus is on the investment preferences of urban and rural area investors more especially on the extent to which they use shares and other government, non-government capital market instruments as vehicles for accumulating their hard-earned savings.

Education

In this project I came to know about the basics of mutual funds, its types and schemes. This project I have done in my MBA (Finance Specialization):

In this Project I came to know about the nature of Investment that differs from individual to individual and is unique to each one because it depends on various parameters like future financial goals, the present & the future income model, capacity to bear the risk, the present requirements and lot more.
